results.title: The Prince of Central Park
results.creator_credit: Harvey Hart and Lorimar Film Entertainment
results.brief_description: Central Park, New York, inhabited nightly by muggers, rapists and killers, becomes the unlikely venue for two recently orphaned children, Jay Jay and Laurie to find a home. They do however, with Jay Jay proclaiming himself ‘The Prince of Central Park’. Into their world enters a lonely widow (Ruth Gordon), who is eager to share their sense of family and belonging. Based on the novel by Evan Rhodes.

results.title: The Point
results.creator_credit: Fred Wolf, Harry Nilsson, Jerry Good, Larry Gordon, Murakami-Wolf Productions and Nilsson House Music
results.brief_description: Based on a fable by Harry Nilsson, this delightful family film is set in the land of Point. In Point, every object, including people, is moulded into a point. Into this world little Oblio is born; the first and only roundheaded child in the town. Oblio and his dog, Arrow, are punished for having no point and are banished to the Pointless Forest. It is not as lonely as they imagined for in the forest they meet several other creatures who have also been exiled because they were different. Join Oblio and Arrow as they discover that you don’t have to have a point to be accepted. Narrated by Ringo Starr and animated by director Fred Wolf.

results.title: Three rivers
results.creator_credit: Harold Tichenor, Tom Radford, National Film Board of Canada and Prairie Productions
results.brief_description: Some forty farmers of the Three Rivers valley in Alberta are opposed to the construction of a dam that will flood their land to provide irrigation for some eight thousand farmers further downstream. They say that a straight cost-benefit argument will cause great injustice, and that building a dam at the proposed site may not, in fact, solve the problem. The farmers maintain that water wastage through badly maintained canals, mismanagement of the watershed and other faults should be dealt with before envisaging construction of a whole new irrigation system.

results.title: Love story = A Woman surrenders
results.creator_credit: Leslie Arliss, Harold Huth and Gainsborough Pictures
results.brief_description: Two people are drawn together in Cornwall during World War II by their shared misfortune. Lissa (Margaret Lockwood), a brilliant concert pianist suffering from a potentially fatal heart condition becomes romantically involved with engaged RAF pilot Kit (Stewart Granger), who is slowly going blind. Neither of the two knows of the predicament of the other, and keeps secret their personal drama. When Lissa learns of Kit’s blindness, she tries to convince him into having a dangerous and experimental operation to restore his sight. Conflict ensues when Lissa and Kit’s financee are at loggerheads as to whether Kit should have the surgery. Cast also includes Patricia Roc, Tom Walls and Reginald Purdell. Screenplay by Leslie Arliss and Doreen Montgomery from a short story by J. W. Drawbell. “Cornish rhapsody” composed by Hubert Bath, played by the National Symphony Orchestra and conducted by Sidney Beer. Solo pianoforte by Harriet Cohen.

results.title: Malice
results.creator_credit: Harold Becker, Charles Mulvehill, Rachel Pfeffer, Castle Rock and New Line Cinema
results.brief_description: Dr. Jed Hill (Alec Baldwin) is an eminent doctor and the new head surgeon at Westerly Hospital. The newlywed Tracy Safian (Nicole Kidman) is admitted to hospital requiring emergency surgery. Dr. Hill defiantly performs an unnecessary operation which leaves her unable to have children. Hit with a $20 million dollar law suit, the truth begins to unravel - this is not the first time the medical whiz with miracle hands has played God, but will it be the last?

results.title: Hitler: a film from Germany = Hitler, Ein Film Aus Deutschland
results.creator_credit: Hans Syberberg, BBC, EDR, I N A, Solaris Film and TMS Film GmbH
results.brief_description: In confronting Nazism Syberberg was not interested in the conventions of realism. In Syberberg’s view, ‘one doesn’t fight Hitler with the statistics of Auschwitz and the sociology of his economic system, but with Richard Wagner and Mozart’. In a series of surrealist tableaux in a variety of dramatic modes - fairytale, circus, morality play, allegorical pageant, magic ceremony, philosophical dialogue - in four parts, Syberberg seeks to embrace, in the words of John Sandford, ‘the mythic totality of Hitler’s world (‘pathos’) and the confrontation of the mythic with reality (‘irony’), the sublime with the ridiculous’. For Susan Sontag ‘it is a ghostly film haunted by (Syberberg’s) great cinematic models (Melies, Eisenstein) and antimodels (Riefenstahl, Hollywood), by German Romanticism (and) above all by Wagner and his music’. Contents: Der gral The grail (96 min.)—A German dream Ein Deutscher Traun (126 min.)—The end of a winter’s tale and the final victory of progress Das ende eines wintermarchens (93 min.)—We children of hell remember the European age Wir kinder der holle (100 min.) Also includes the book ‘Syberberg, A filmmaker from Germany’. In German and English with English subtitles.

results.title: Go fish
results.creator_credit: Rose Troche, Guinevere Turner, Can I Watch Pictures, Islet and KVPI
results.brief_description: Shot in black and white, on a low budget and using a predominantly non-professional cast, Rose Troche’s first feature offers an inside view of lesbian life in the ‘90’s. Max is looking for love, Ely suffers from a long distance relationship and their scheming friends are determined to match them. Navigated by a wistful narration, the film tracks the inter-linked cast of characters from cafes and bookshops to dinner parties, dates and sex. Starring Guinevere Turner, V. S. Brodie, T. Wendy McMillan, Migdalia Melendez and Anastasia Sharp. Screenplay by Rose Troche and Guinevere Turner.

results.title: Intermezzo
results.creator_credit: Gregory Ratoff, David O. Selznick and David O Selznick Productions
results.brief_description: A tragic but moving love story starring Ingrid Bergmann and Leslie Howard. The great concert violonist Holger Brandt is attracted to Anita Hoffman although he is happily married. He soon finds his love for Anita overwhelming and leaves his wife to tour Europe with her. But he cannot leave his past and his family ties behind and Anita sensing his dilemma, leaves him although it breaks her heart. Eventually Holgar and his wife are reunited as they share a personal tragedy. Sentimental, ‘Intermezzo’ is a great romantic classic.

results.title: Man belongs to the earth
results.creator_credit: Graeme Ferguson, Roman Kroitor and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: Deals with the natural environment of United States cities, the desert, the oceans, and the mountains. Shows the dead waste and destruction threatening the environment, and the natural wonders that should be preserved. Presents the problems and some solutions.

results.title: Mousehunt
results.creator_credit: Gore Verbinski, Alan Richie, Bruce Cohen, Tony Ludwig and NBCUniversal
results.brief_description: When their elderly father dies, two brothers inherit the family business - the Smuntz string factory - along with a dilapidated house. Ernie Smuntz (Nathan Lane) was a once revered chef but is no more thanks to an unfortunate incident involving the mayor and a cockroach; brother Lars (Lee Evans) is a devoted string factory worker. On viewing the house they discover that it was designed by a revered architect at the turn of the century and is potentially worth millions. The only obstacle to the impending fortune is one wily long time resident, a mouse that’s proving impossible to catch. Christopher Walken has a brief role as a pest exterminator. The film is rated PG due to potentially horrible traps laid by each opponent, including a freakish cat. Cast also includes Vicki Lewis, Eric Christmas and Maury Chaykin.
